content: can girl textured buttercup sweater ameri by patricia klonoski materials ww yarn size g hook yarn needle small amount of ribbon abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet v- stitch 1dc ch1 1dc in same stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet st stitch shell 2dc ch1 2dc all in same stitch fan stitch 5 dcs into the same stitch note the ch2 at the beginning of each row counts as a stitch bodice starting with neckline and with g hook chain 37 row 1 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and in each of the next 4 chs v_stitch in next chain double_crochet in next 4 chs v_stitch in next chain double_crochet in next 12 chs v_stitch in next chain double_crochet in next 4 chs v_stitch in next chain double_crochet in last 6 chs ch2 turn row 2 *double_crochet to the first ch1 space v_stitch in that ch1 space* repeat *-* to end of row ch2 turn row 3-repeat row 2 row 4- creating the arm holes half_double_crochet to first ch1 space half_double_crochet ch2 in that space skip to the next ch1 space half_double_crochet in that space and in every stitch to the next ch1 space half_double_crochet ch2 in that space skip to next ch1 space half_double_crochet in that space and in every stitch to the end of the row ch2 turn your arm holes are now complete row 5 half_double_crochet in each stitch and ch2 space across ch2 turn row 6 skip one stitch 1dc in next stitch *skip one stitch shell in next skip one stitch double_crochet in next * repeat *-* to end of row working 1dc in the last 3sticthes in the row ch2 turn row 7 double_crochet in the first 2 stitches *skip 1 stitch shell in ch1 space of shell in previous row skip 1 stitch fpdc around double_crochet in previous row skip a stitch * repeat *-* to end of row double_crochet in last 2 stitches of the row ch2 turn row 8-15 repeat row 7 row 16 1dc in first stitch *fan stitch in the first ch1 space of the shell on the previous row single_crochet in the top of the double_crochet on the previous row* repeat *-* to end of the row 1 double_crochet in last 2 stitches ch1 do not turn finishing 3 single_crochet in same ch1 single_crochet evenly up the side work 3sc in the corner stitch and continue working around the neckline work 3sc in the corner stitch and continue down the other side of the sweater dress join with slip_stitch to the top of the first double_crochet on the bottom row fasten_off sleeves attach yarn to middle stitch under the arm pit ch2 round 1 double_crochet evenly around join to top of ch2 round 2-7 repeat round 1 round 8 2hdc in each stitch around chain 2 round 9 1hdc in each stitch around join to top of chain 2 fo embellish neckline with ribbon and enjoy patricia klonoski@2017
